videos.title: V8: The Engine of America | Full Documentary
videos.description:
When discussing the future of the automobile there are those who are quick to spool up the doom and gloom, foreshadowing an Orwellian not-too-distant-future where we‚Äôre all trudging around town in engineless husks, but here at MotorTrend we don‚Äôt think that‚Äôs necessarily the case.

We‚Äôve been living in the golden age of internal combustion, especially when it comes to the V8. At no point in history have V8 engines, and the cars and trucks they are in, been more powerful or efficient, or more suited for both work and play.

In this documentary film we'll detail the V8‚Äôs history before diving into the technology that makes modern V8s both powerful and efficient. We‚Äôll talk to the OEMs who still endeavor to keep the spark alive amid legislative flux, and get into the future of the V8 and why we're so optimistic about it. We will tell the story of the V8 - drawing on expert testimonial, badass visuals, and unparalleled access to OEM experts, racing mechanics, aftermarket leaders, and garage enthusiasts, to deliver an unapologetic love letter to the rumbling heart of automotive culture.

#V8 #Engine #Ford #GTD #Chevrolet #ZR1 #Hemi #Flathead #Documentary #HotRod #motortrend 
 
For more visit, the newly relaunched ‚û°Ô∏è https://hotrod.com

videos.title: Ultimate Adventure 2022 Ep 3: Pisgah National Forest and a Spooky Penitentiary! | MotorTrend
videos.description:
Day 4 of Ultimate Adventure (UA) started with a bang ‚Ä¶ well, for at least one person on the trip. In the first ten miles of the day, Ian Johnson of FourWheeler TV fame locked up the 5.3-liter engine and/or roached the 4L60E transmission on the Chevy "Crawlerado" Colorado he recently completed for RealTruck. Fortunately, for 2022, Ultimate Adventure is being held relatively close to Ian's Big Tire Garage in Mount Pleasant, Tennessee.

After about twelve miles of pavement, the Ultimate Adventure crew dropped into the picturesque Pisgah National Forest and followed Hurricane Creek for approximately 18 miles. Next they passed Max Patch before returning to pavement and clocking off another 120 miles to Petros, Tennessee. Petros is home to the Brushy Mountain Penitentiary, which has been closed for the past five years and is now a museum. After a spooky tour of the prison, the group made its way to nearby Oliver Springs to camp at Windrock Park. A low country boil dinner was provided courtesy of Skyjacker and cooked by past UA participant Travis Farmer. With full stomachs, everyone set up camp for the night, excited to explore what Windrock has to offer on Day 5 of the Ultimate Adventure.

 #Offroad #4x4 #wheelin #UltimateAdventure2022 #UA2022

videos.title: The Future of Driving? | Coding the Car | MotorTrend
videos.description:
It‚Äôs a little known fact that without software, today‚Äôs cars would not move, let alone perform thousands of functions. The automotive industry is set to change more in the next five years than in the previous 50 years, driven in large part by the arrival of the Software-Defined Vehicle (SDV). SDVs are fundamentally altering the relationship between passenger and vehicle with apps and over-the-air software updates, constantly improving safety features, preventing recalls, adding wanted customer features, improving performance and increasing efficiency to create a more sustainable transportation network. 

MotorTrend's Software-Defined Innovator Vehicle Awards looks to celebrate the innovators and companies that ultimately make the average car more intelligent and capable than vehicles on the road today.

videos.title: THE MOST UNIQUE CYBERTRUCKS IN ONE PLACE!
videos.description:
Attended SEMA 2024 to see how many Tesla Cybertrucks infultrated the notoriously gas car centric auto parts show! This took me so many hours and walking so many miles to make this video! lol.

Shoudl I go back to Sema Next year? Get ready for some great Car content this week and also a car crash video update. We also will have a home video coming soon!

videos.title: NEW ELECTRIC MERCEDES!  THE BEST YET!
videos.description:
Mercedes Electric SLA is here! Let's take a first look with Ola K√§llenius, Mercedes Benz CEO. Super nice guy! First ride and impressions.

Will this more entry level Electric car be adopted in a big way around the world? It is like a Tesla Model 3 but with Mercedes luxury and efficiency. More details will be shown soon but thanks for watching this special interview!

The Efficiency of the motor and batteries should give around 466 miles range! I'll be doing a deep dive on the motor and batteries soon!

videos.title: PLAYING 18 HOLES AT BRITISH OPEN!
videos.description:
Royal Troon was an incredible venue for The Open and we played the course Monday morning after the Pros played with the same hole locations! 

This is the 4th and final video in our incredible 11 day trip with Mercedes to The Open. This might be the last Youtube Video Lincoln is in for at least 2 years as he leaves on his Church Mission. I may have shown more of the golf in this video than I originally planned, but, I'm going to miss Lincoln and this was such a special trip that I wanted to capture all of it for myself and I know there are some of our fans that will miss Lincoln also. 

Here are the 4 videos we made in this trip:
Video 1 Goodwood: https://youtu.be/iBA2d1co6Gs
Video 2 G-Turn: https://youtu.be/64EywaxkCV0
Video 3 Staying in Castle: https://youtu.be/UiYp6bu164c

Check out Seb and his youtube channel: @SebOnGolf

Sorry about the first 3 or 4 minutes, I messed up my mic setting and could barely hear me! Ugh. Still Goodwood Race is such an incredible event and Mercedes stole the show!

This is day 1 of a 4 part series of a VERY special trip the the UK for our last trip before he leaves the home for 2 years. It is such a cool experience so stay tuned.

videos.title: GTA V Watermelon flip! #gta
videos.description:
"GTA V Watermelon Flip Challenge! (EPIC Stunts & Funny Moments)"


Welcome back to another wild adventure in Los Santos! In this GTA V video, we take on the ultimate challenge: the Watermelon Flip! Join us as we attempt insane stunts, hilarious moments, and epic fails while attempting to flip watermelons in the most creative ways possible.

üçâ What's the Watermelon Flip Challenge? üçâ
The rules are simple: grab a watermelon, find the craziest vehicle you can, and attempt to launch the watermelon into the air with style! From motorcycles to fighter jets, we'll try it all!

üöó Epic Stunts & Funny Moments ü§£
Watch as we push the limits of sanity with jaw-dropping stunts and laugh-out-loud moments. Whether it's soaring through the sky or crashing into buildings, you won't believe what we can do with a watermelon and a dream.

üéÆ Join the Fun!
Think you can outdo our watermelon-flipping skills? Grab your controller and join us in the chaos of GTA V! Share your own epic stunts and funny moments in the comments below. Don't forget to like, subscribe, and hit that notification bell so you never miss out on our latest adventures!

#GTAV #WatermelonFlip #Gaming #FunnyMoments #Stunts #Challenges

Get ready for the craziest ride of your life ‚Äì it's time to flip some watermelons in GTA V!

videos.title: GTA V Cleaning Spiderman and Spidey! #gta
videos.description:
Cleaning Spiderman and Spidey! | GTA V Mod Gameplay


Welcome back to another exciting GTA V mod gameplay! In today's episode, we dive into the chaotic world of Los Santos as we take on the roles of the iconic Spiderman and Spidey. But, as heroes, even they need a bit of cleaning up, right? Join us as we swing through the city, fighting crime and causing mayhem, all while trying to keep our spandex suits looking pristine. Will we succeed, or will our attempts at cleanliness be foiled by the chaos of the city? Tune in to find out!

Don't forget to like, subscribe, and hit the notification bell to never miss an episode of our GTA V adventures! #GTAV #Spiderman #Gaming

channel.description:
‚ÄúVlad & Niki‚Äù is the global preschool phenomenon and highest rated kids channel on YouTube starring the imaginative personalities and antics of brothers Vlad and Niki, who are showcased in non-stop fun and crazy adventures. Since launching on YouTube in 2018, the ‚ÄúVlad & Niki‚Äù has attracted more than 456+ million subscribers worldwide and 248+ billion views, while averaging five billion monthly views on 21 channels and translated into 18 languages. Each episode is produced with a creative mix of live action, animation and music to create comedic videos for the preschool demographic. "Vlad & Niki" is the property of Content Media Group FZC, LLC, headed by co-founders Sergey and Victoria Vashketov, the parents of global superstar kidfluencers Vlad and Niki.

Join Vlad and Niki as they explore the exciting world of Miko Robots! Miko is the ultimate AI-powered companion, bringing endless fun with its interactive features, voice recognition, and engaging learning experiences. Designed for kids aged 4 to 10, Miko combines fun and intelligence, offering dance, stories, music, and empathetic conversations that spark curiosity and foster STEAM learning. channel.name: Joseph's Machines
channel.description: JOSEPH'S MACHINES solve everyday problems using familiar objects in unfamiliar ways. He creates them in his studio in London, UK.

videos.title: Joseph's Machines Channel Trailer
videos.description:

The Salvo 12 is modular in nature ‚Äî the shooter can add or remove sections to balance their sound suppression, weight and length needs. At its full length of 12 inches, it brings sound down to 137 dB at the muzzle ‚Äî well below the 140 dB hearing-safe level set by OSHA. 

Whether you grab a shotgun for hunting, shooting clays or home defense, the Salvo 12 fits most common shotguns ‚Äî provided you have a choked barrel. The suppressor attaches to the the existing choke threads via an adapter. Due to differences in shotgun manufacturer and choke preference, it is important that you select the correct adapter.

videos.title: Secret Service Weaponry!
videos.description:
Click2Tweet: http://clicktotweet.com/d9xiL
My 2nd Channel: http://www.youtube.com/morefpsrussia
My Shirts: http://tinyurl.com/cy7fh2h
Twitter: http://twitter.com/THEFPSHOW
FaceBook: http://www.facebook.com/FPSRUSSIA
Filmed & Edited by:  http://www.youtube.com/user/funkertactical

The blue SUV we blew up has a funny story behind it.  I bought it 2 years ago for $3000 which was a pretty good deal considering my friends and I put over 50,000 miles on it in those 2 years.  So when I began filming this video I had a cheap 4 door white car that ran pretty well.  Id bought it for $800 and knew it was no prize but it was perfect for driving in a field for 5 minutes then getting blown to bits.  Unfortunately one of the guys who works for me decided to take it for "a little spin" just before we were to film the videos last segment.  He somehow managed to blow up the engine and I was left with 2 options:  I could either scrap the video concept and pay for another day of filming which would be very costly.  Or I could blow up the SUV which btw the guy who broke the original car had been driving for over a month.  Unfortunately for him the decision was easy, we got his stuff out, through in 13lbs of explosives and a few gallons of fuel and said goodbye to the Montero.

Hog Hunting Video:     http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=B7eIExz8tog&list=UUYvlBEeEEoJE8uP7WWzPmnA&index=1&feature=plcp

Vertex has developed an Aerial Hunter Safety Course that is specific to hunters who would be hiring a helicopter service to hunt hogs. "This isn't your normal 'Hunting Class', either." continues Morgan, "This is an intensive safety course that will prepare the hunter to be able to know everything that they need to know about shooting from a helicopter, what do to in case of an emergency, and even helps them to understand the liability implications of worst case scenarios."

"What happens if they accidentally shoot a rotor blade? What happens if they drop a magazine and it goes through the tail rotor?  Things like this can destroy a helicopter.  If it happens, who is liable?  Our course gives the hunter detailed guidance on everything from the type of helicopter to contract, the best choice of weapon, how to shoot effectively, how to communicate with the pilot, and state laws governing hunting from a helicopter. The most important part of our training course is the hands-on actual firing from the helicopter at ground targets while the helicopter is moving."

"We look forward to seeing this bill pass, but we feel strongly that there need to be very strict safety parameters put in place.  Many of these aircraft cost in excess of $300,000, so if a hunter isn't operating safely, or accidentally causes damage to a helicopter or injures someone then it's all over the news with negative publicity. Our goal is to help prevent these problems and to make helicopter hunting a safe venture."

Vertex Helicopters offers their Aerial Hunting Safety Course at least one weekend per month at a cost of $350 per attendee. The course is an all-day course with 4 hours of classroom instruction in the morning and hands-on training in the helicopter on an active range during the afternoon.  Each class is limited to 12 people to keep the instruction more concentrated, resulting in more interaction and additional time for hands-on training. Depending on the location, VERTEX Helicopters will travel with one of the aircraft to perform the classes for larger groups at remote locations when scheduling allows.

VERTEX Helicopters is a full service helicopter company  located at 8888 W. Monroe Rd at Hobby Airport in Houston, Texas.  They can be reached at (281) 888-9620 or you can visit their website or email them directly.

Nice guys come in two different types: toxic and masculine. Knowing the difference is critical because some traits women desire and crave. Nothing is wrong with being nice, but something is wrong with being toxic. A toxic guy is overly accommodating and overly nice. He's overly kind and always prioritizes somebody else's needs. He thinks that by doing this, people will like him more. The reality is that nobody treats him well because nobody respects him. It's impossible to get respect when you're a doormat, and women pick up on this. Don't do things because you think you're going to get something. Do things because it's the right thing to do. On the flip side, the masculine nice guy shows kindness, but he also shows strength and assertiveness. He takes control of situations and can give himself. These characteristics are irresistible to women.

Genuine kindness without agenda. Being genuine is one of the most attractive traits that a man can possess. Instead of doing things for people because he thinks he will get something in return (having an agenda), he's genuinely kind. He does things because it's the right thing; this man is authentic.

Being self-assured with confidence and humility. Many men put on an act of confidence, trying to show the world or prove something. A self-assured man knows his value, and he's not trying to act like his sh!t doesn't stink. He knows his strengths and owns his flaws. These are sexy qualities because everyone likes to be around someone who can make fun of themselves and doesn't take themselves too seriously. You shouldn't put yourself down, however. There's a big difference between owning imperfections and constantly putting yourself down.

Assertiveness. Set boundaries and not say 'yes' to everything. Know when to protect yourself from being taken advantage of.

Charisma. Being charismatic includes how you present yourself, smell, stand, body language, confidence, eye contact, and style. A woman loves a man who takes ownership of his presentation and personal packaging. Don't dress average‚Äîstand out by looking good and caring for your personal brand. Gain respect by taking care of your personal packaging, which is one of the easiest steps. Dress well, be well groomed, and smell amazing. Here's how to smell amazing! Use my code alpham20 to receive 20% OFF your total Gisada order! Remember that body language can take some work, but you can master it, too.

Motivation. When a nice guy is underperforming at his job, career, or life, he's worried about fitting in and not rocking the boat. He does what's expected instead of what's in his heart. You shouldn't apologize for wanting more or going after your dreams. Be assertive and realize your potential. Don't let life bend you over.

BEST HAIRSTYLES FOR EACH FACE SHAPE

ROUND Increase facial angularity because one of the downsides to having a round face is not having structure. A round face is a bit softer, so choose a hairstyle to enhance its angularity. Choose a hairstyle that has more weight or volume on the top to elongate the face. Go with shorter, tapered sides to help create the visual illusion of more structure to your head. If you have a hairstyle that has sharp angles or a lot of texture, it will help offset and balance a round face. Contrast is what it boils down to.


The textured crop with the high fade is also perfect for round faces. The tapered sides (faded and high) with the textured top add interest and balance, elongating the face visually.
Add facial hair, but the secret is to taper it. If you have facial hair with a round face, a big and bushy style accentuate the roundness. Take it short & tight and blend it to your sides to avoid a hard line. Gradually taper it or fade it down to the chin, which should be slightly longer than the hair on the cheeks.

SQUARE. A square face has crazy angles and a very strong and structured appearance. Offset those with the softness of a hairstyle by opting for longer or more flowy styles to elongate the face and soften some hard angles. Instead of a rigid or structured hairstyle, choose something softer and with textured layers. Grow your hair a bit longer to contrast & balance to this face shape.


The bro flow is amazing for a structured face. With the bro flow waves, the hairstyle has natural volume and texture to be a bit softer and complement and contrast the squareness of the face.
Center-part curtains is also another great option for this face shape. Old-money aesthetic hairstyles will look incredible because of their structure, squareness, and softness. The center part curtain will soften everything, but it shouldn't be too pencil-straight. You need a definition, layers, and possibly some razoring.
If you want to go with something shorter, the French crop will work as long as there's texture up top and bangs are pulled down onto the forehead. Don't go super tight or super high. I recommend leaving hair slightly longer on the sides to make the style rounder and softer.
Don't shave your head because this will accentuate the structure and squareness of your face. You could go for a crew cut, leaving a little hair on top and tapering the sides to round everything out visually. Adding facial hair with a crew cut is even better. Facial hair helps balance the face and draws the eye down.
Growing chin hair slightly longer than the cheeks will also draw the eye down and eliminate the illusion of a square face.

UPSIDE-DOWN TRIANGLE. This face shape is wider at the top and drops to a pointy chin. You'll need softness.
Curtains will help make the forehead less noticeable and help balance the face shape.
The bro flow and the classic side part are a great option. Add a bit of fringe to help camouflage the size of the forehead.
Textured fringe is another amazing option. Whether you want to go super tight or a high fade is a personal preference.
A messy fringe will look incredible and help camouflage the forehead. It'll also add texture and softness.
Add facial hair to look even better. Allow it to be one length and a bit puffier in the cheek area to round out the jaw. Do not grow a beard that is tapered or pointy because that will accentuate the shape of the face.

OVAL.  This face shape can rock any style and looks amazing as long as the hair texture and style work correctly. The face shape has amazing symmetry built into the structure of the face. If you want a more angular hairstyle, that's great. You could also have a softer hairstyle as well.

Beard. A beard will make you attractive and feel more confident. Men with beards are viewed as more trustworthy, but there's a caveat. People won't trust you if the beard's too long, big, bushy, or unkempt. Ensure your beard is short to medium length, well groomed, and edged.

Rolex watch. People recognize Rolex, and they will automatically give respect even if they are of a higher status. Wearing one will boost your self-esteem and make you more confident. When it comes to making money, whether in sales or getting a promotion, you can wear one and automatically boost your self-esteem. This translates into confidence when you walk into a room.

Navy suit. Tailored to perfection, a standard, solid navy suit will help you ascend that corporate letter and make you more money. Navy is the best color for being trusted, so politicians often wear navy suits.

Tone it down. When earning the most money you can make, tone down fashion risks and thinking outside the box. Super fashion-forward people are different, and sometimes people get weird about that. They don't know how to interpret it. So, to maximize your career opportunities, tone it down.

High-quality leather shoes. When someone walks into a room and has good shoes, the subliminal message is sent that they respect themselves and are trustworthy. They get the job done and are worthy of your business. These shoes can instantly be noticed. They should be stylish, clean, and presentable.

Belts. Belts kill a lot of guys because they're beat up, indicating they're lazy, unkempt, and not responsible. Your belt should also match your shoes and coordinate with your outfit. Anson Belts are the best on the market because they're interchangeable and don't have any holes. They work on a track system.

Sport coat. A nice tailored sports coat, whether or not it's navy or Houndstooth, is a great investment. A sports coat elevates your aesthetic and perception when you walk into a room.

Leather bags and briefcases. If you carry all your crap in a duffel bag or a cheap backpack, people will lose respect for you. You won't have the same street credibility as somebody carrying a higher-quality item like a leather bag or briefcase. One of these shows that you are professional and appreciate finer things. It's all about trust as well.

Classic white tailored dress shirt. Dress shirts will make you more money. But they have to be clean, crisp, and tailored. The more your clothing fits you, the more the right messages are sent about you. Invest in tailoring. Plus, the color white since the message that your trustworthy and professional.

Stylish eyewear. Eyewear makes the statement that you're intelligent and stylish. Get a cool pair of frames that structure your face and make you look more interesting.

Rings. Avoid these in professional environments other than a wedding band. It looks a bit low-class if you're rocking a bunch of rings.

Jewelry. Avoid bracelets and earrings. You shouldn't be able to see your chains. Cufflinks and tie bars are a possible investment and a great addition. They send a message that you're more polished and put together. A tie bar lets people know that you pay attention to details.

Hairstyle. If you're rocking an outdated style, such as a mullet or a flat top, or using a lot of hair product that makes your hair look crispy, oily, or greasy, people don't trust you because you're viewed as outdated or gross. You need to be viewed as hygienic. Look for a style that's a bit more on the conservative side, even an old-money hairstyle.

How you smell. You need to be careful in the workplace because many people are sensitive to smells. Don't use a lot of fragrance because it can negatively impact you. Use one or two squirts to make sure it's subtle and subdued.

Today, I will discuss crossbody bags and bags in general, including backpacks and wallets. These are items that can distinguish boys from men. We talk a lot about style and personal presentation, and how you carry your crap is one of those factors that often gets overlooked. We use these bags daily, so you need to pay attention and invest in what you're using. How you carry your stuff matters because people notice, so one of the quickest ways to elevate your aesthetic is to elevate the way you carry your crap. Here's what you should not (and should!) carry


Wallet. If your wallet is big and fat, it looks ridiculous. It also jacks up the clean lines of your clothing. If your wallet has velcro or graphic designs, you'll look like an immature little boy. I recommend a simple and clean minimal wallet, which I got from Thursday Boots. It's simple and fits nicely in the front pocket of your pants. It won't jack up your posture.


Suitcases. Nice luggage is a game-changer. Whether you're going on a vacation or a weekend getaway, how you pack your crap says a lot about you. Invest in a luggage set with a roller carry-on and a suitcase; a must for every adult man.


Dopp kit. Invest in a high-quality dopp kit because it's worth your money. You'll have it for years. Again, I got mine from Thursday Boots. The different pockets can carry different grooming products.


Oversized duffel bags. I fell for this and got myself a couple, but I never use them. Once you pack these, they are heavy as hell. They also don't have wheels, so you must lug it around. They are super impractical, even though they look awesome. They're a waste of money because you can invest in higher-quality luggage. Now, a duffle bag for the gym is practical.


Gym bag. The string bags that are popular suck, and you don't look like an adult man. Conversely, a gym bag shouldn't be gigantic, toting your protein, pre-workout, supplements, wraps, several clothing changes, shoes, etc. You need a smaller, manageable gym bag that's darker because it will be sitting on the ground. Your gym bag will get beat up and get nasty and smell, so keep that in mind.


Backpacks. I have a love-hate relationship with backpacks. They are not stylish or sexy. They are functional, especially if you're going to hike somewhere and want to pack it full of supplies. They're also great for picnics. There are better options for backpacks, such as the matte-black leather backpack with different bells and whistles. You can find one at Thursday Boots with a rugged and masculine aesthetic. This type of backpack will upgrade your aesthetic simply and easily.


Computer bag. Opt for a rugged and stylish computer bag rather than a boring nylon pedestrian style. Carrying a more stylish bag automatically conveys that you're reliable, responsible, and appreciate quality. You'll get more opportunities.


Man-bags. If you're heading out for the afternoon, you may have a few things you want to carry. Perhaps you're going on a nice outing or a festival and don't want to carry all your stuff in your pockets, and a backpack seems overkill. A man-bag is what you should be looking for -- it's a small bag that's minimal. There are a lot of great brands out there, from Tumi to NutSac to Diesel. You can find them at discount stores like Nordstrom Rack. They're the perfect size to carry around.


Fanny pack. The fanny pack is not stylish. Most of the guys I see wearing these fanny packs are younger.


Crossbody bag. If you're a mature man, this is not the style that you should be going for. I recommend a man-bag with a longer strap. You can look incredibly cool and super rugged.

videos.title: How to Make a Relationship LAST | Interviewing My wife of 21 years
videos.description:
Visit JamesAllen through the Alpha m. special link: https://bit.ly/48CrOSQ and take advantage of the limited time amazing offers on 
diamonds, earth and lab created diamonds, engagement rings, bracelets, earrings, and other fine jewelry - here https://bit.ly/48CrOSQ

Thank you to JamesAllen.com for sponsoring this video and partnering with us for close to 9 years. #jamesallen #diamonds #jewelry #engagement

This video is special because I invited my wife to discuss relationships. We've been together for 21 years, and I want to reveal some of the steps we've taken to stay together in a world of everybody calling it quits super quick. I look around at many of my friends and realize that staying together for a long time is not as prevalent as it used to be. Marriage is hard, and life happens. Also, I think social media makes it harder. Some people decide they can't do it anymore and that they'd be better off alone or with someone else. It's easy to bail, but staying together takes work and commitment. However, don't be delusional, thinking that relationships will always be all roses and sunshine. Relationships have challenges, and you'll have issues.¬†


We met at a Mexican restaurant, and it was easy. We were friends, and all the boxes were checked. We were immediately inseparable. She was very independent and successful, and at the time, I was a struggling fitness center owner. We dated for four years, and then I asked her to marry me. I didn't have JamesAllen.com come back then, so I had to go to a store. Now, we only use JamesAllen because we don't like overpaying.

After we tied the knot, we had some ups and downs, just like every relationship. Here's how we've worked through some of them:

We've worked through them because we're committed, but neither has done any 'unforgivables.'


We also haven't had children, which can stress a marriage. Raising children is expensive, and financial struggles can develop as a result. We've seen children complete a marriage, but we've also seen marriages split from children.


Financial situations can result in conflicts in a marriage. We have separate finances, each with our own bank accounts. This has been beneficial, but we are in line financially and physically. We are like-minded, and neither of us is a big spender. We live below our means and are on the same page.


While couples often butt heads regarding money and children, overcoming philosophical differences is also extremely challenging. Realize that you can't change someone, but someone can/will change. I'm a different person than I was when I first got married. We both have had evolutions, but we are aligned with marriage. Sometimes, people grow in different directions, and your partner may not be aligned with it. This could be a deal breaker.


Another challenge is that sometimes, the little things become bigger deals or issues as time goes on. You can accept someone's personality quirks or issues, but sometimes, they can drive you crazy after a long time. I drive her crazy because of my intensity and how I micromanage. I'm constantly trying to be better, and I'm constantly putting in effort every single day. It's a process


Communication as a couple is key. You must listen and let each other know what they need to work on. Sometimes, it's really hard in the heat of frustration or resentment. If you're arguing, it's hard to get to that point of communicating and listening. But sometimes, you must learn to walk away because people communicate and argue differently. I am an overcommunicator, but my wife sometimes needs me to walk away and let the situation simmer down at times.


Understand what your partner needs and why your partner needs that. Give them what they need because you know where they're coming from.


Make sure that you're helping around the house and not being a filthy slob. You need to show respect for the other person. Don't go out and do stupid things, which could cause many issues in the relationship. Relationships should be mutually beneficial, as well as your support system. My wife is my rock and part of my support system. We've surrounded ourselves with better people who are also part of that support system.

 There's a downside to trying to make your body do something that it's not supposed to, and that's what I want to talk about today. This aspect is underreported because many worry about looking a certain way. They see people on social media and try to look like them by dieting and working out like crazy. Some men even take steroids and do other actions that are detrimental to their bodies. I also have a new perspective on fitness and diet. As my body has gotten older, everything has gotten harder. Putting on muscle, staying lean, looking good with my shirt off, and other aspects have become more challenging. If that's you, don't beat yourself up and do destructive things in the process.

Your genetic predisposition
Have a body that is realistic to your genetic predisposition. You can have an amazing body through consistency in diet, working out, and exercise, but don't go beyond your genetic potential. A lot of issues arise when you do. When I was at 5% body fat, I was abusing my body. I was dehydrated and had low energy because I wasn't eating carbohydrates. I felt like crap. This extremely low body fat percentage can cause your hormones to get messed up because your body needs fats and carbohydrates to regulate all the hormonal functions. When you go super low, you won't feel as good because your energy is in the toilet, and your body fat drops so that hormones get out of whack. Testosterone also drops, which translates into a lower sex drive. When I was super focused on my body, I didn't have any friends because I was super obsessed with it. My mind got messed up because it's intoxicating when you see the definition. You feel good about how you look at that moment, but it's not reality or sustainable. My identity was tied to my appearance, as I was muscular and lean and had chiseled abs. When that became harder, or I didn't pay as much attention to it, I got depressed. When you push yourself to a limit that your body doesn't want to go, it won't last. But you'll beat yourself up and be upset because you feel like you failed if you don't sustain it. You feel fat and out of shape, but the reality is wildly different than that. As I've gotten older, I have a better handle on my mind and know what is possible. I'm not saying to let yourself go or get sloppy fat. You have to take care of your body, but you don't have to kill yourself in the process.

Current diet and goals
My current diet is about consistency. In my old days, I spent my meals prepping and eating a lot of boiled chicken, sweet potatoes, and broccoli. I was missing out on everything, including pizza and life. Over the years, I've learned it's not about eating many small meals daily. It's about restricting calories. It's about calories in and calories out. I still enjoy meal prepping and paying attention to my diet. I also use Factor to have some delicious and tasty food, but it's not boring or basic. It keeps me on my macronutrient game. My current goals are not trying to get bigger. I'm just trying to look good for my age. The goal for everyone should be to look good for their body. I don't want to be embarrassed when I take off my shirt at the beach. Back in the day, I was never satisfied with my physique. Sure, you should continue trying to get better, but you should not constantly chase the idea of perfection. It cannot be obtained because it's an exercise in self-destructive futility. Compare yourself to who you were yesterday and who you want to be tomorrow. Do not look at other people with envy or with an unrealistic perspective. Do what you need to do for your age: eat healthy, exercise, and get enough sleep. You also need to make sure your micronutrients are taken care of. I need magnesium, vitamin D, and zinc, along with other trace minerals, to really give my body the tools it needs to be healthy at my age.

Value health over physical looks

Men are facing a loneliness epidemic. In a recent study, 20% of men said they had no close friends. Despite being connected worldwide like never before, men feel more isolated than ever. 80% of suicides are men. The problem is that their mental states erode if they don't have connections, making them feel lonelier. Friendships provide an outlet to help solve problems and deal with stress and anxiety.¬† I'm on a mission to help guys look amazing, and part of that feeling incredible is developing strong personal relationships. I want to discuss this loneliness epidemic, why we got here, and how to escape this rut. Here's how you can develop longer-lasting and better relationships.

Why are men becoming lonelier? The way that relationships and friendships are approached needs to be changed. The internet has messed us up in terms of friendships and feeling connected. We've gotten into a bad habit of consuming content rather than interacting. Relationships are give and take, and we must communicate to build friendships. You share things about yourself and have a common ground to build a relationship. Because of social media, we consume other people's content, which gives us a hit of dopamine but causes us to lack motivation to go out and earn that dopamine. Playing video games online is no substitute for interactions. It's not building friendships or relationships, and you're not having shared experiences. People aren't going out for organized sports like they used to. These team environments are a foundation and why you become friends with certain people. You have shared experiences, hardships, and learning experiences. These things build camaraderie and connection. Church is another place where people can meet others weekly. Further, fewer men are getting married and are single more than ever. This prevents us from feeling fulfilled and connected and can make a man feel lonely. However, marriage often includes children, and when your buddy gets married, you see him less and less, leaving you feeling like you've lost a friend. Another reason men feel lonely is that they're not working in the office like they did pre-pandemic. Working remotely doesn't allow you to build those friendships in which people need emotional outlets in their male friendships.

HOW TO CONNECT AND MAKE DEEPER CONNECTIONS:

Take off your headphones. Whether at the gym or coffee shop, if you have headphones on, it automatically shuts other people down. They feel they're bothering you if they want to speak with you.


Spend less time on your devices. The more time you spend on your devices, the less connected you feel and become. Get your dopamine from a healthy source.


Get active. Join a sports team or a meet-up and connect with real people in your area.

Start saying yes. If you're serious about being less lonely, you have to stop saying no.


Find people in your area with similar interests. Find groups you enjoy going to with people who have things in common. Whether it's a convention or something weird you think you're the only person into, explore and find people in your area with these interests. These can recur monthly or weekly, so you'll see these people repeatedly.


Join intramural sports. If you're in your 20s, 30s, or 40s and want to be active and engaged, join an intramural team.


Don't put off reaching out. Don't wait for the right invitation. Contact old friends and people you know casually if you're serious about feeling less lonely. See if they want to get together and hike, get coffee, or grab a bite. Even people you've worked with that you think you have something in common could reach out to them and be the conduit pulling everything together.

But let me be clear: I'm not saying she is the one for you or the one you should be with. If you guys broke up or she dumped you, chances are there's a fundamental problem with the relationship. But regarding your ego, her wanting you back doesn't hurt to make you feel better. So here's my six-step plan to make her come crawling back to you.

STEP ONE: Zero contact. This means no text messaging, no accidentally running into her, no butt dialing her, or even calling her when you're drunk. This is zero contact for 30 days. Absence does make the heart grow fonder, but if you are somebody who's burning up her phone or is always around, she doesn't have time to miss you. This step is hard because your heart is broken, and you want to connect. You want to explain yourself and have a conversation. But zero contact is incredibly emotionally effective and gives her time to think about you. She doesn't think about the bad times, only the good times. So she'll focus on that.

STEP TWO: Self-improvement. Take better care of yourself, which will demonstrate growth. Start going to the gym if you're not already. Get your body fat down. In 30 days, you could get down 5 to 10 lbs. Combining diet and exercise will make your body look better, and your confidence skyrocket. Your face will become more angular and defined. While you're doing this, work on your style. Dress well and make sure your clothing fits your body. Taking better care of yourself signals that you're thriving and not fixated on her. She'll be curious if there's somebody else. Another step is to start taking care of your skin. Tiege Hanley will help your skin to look clean, clear, and radiate. Level One is an incredible deal featuring four amazing products that you can use for this 30-day crawl back plan.

STEP THREE: Do not post on social media. You need to go dark. Keep her guessing, thinking, and worrying.

STEP FOUR: Send one text. After 30 days, send a casual and friendly text. Something on committal. Something like you come back from the dead, and she will realize you've moved on. Keep it casual and not about anything significant like, ‚ÄúI saw something that made me think of you.‚Äù respond with something that she likes, whether or not it was a restaurant or a place that you want together that she loved or had a good time at. This will trigger fond memories.

STEP FIVE: Trigger positive emotions. She will now start to think about the good things about your relationship. This will make her miss you. Remember, she hasn't talked to you in 30 days and has no idea if you're dating someone. By being confident and not kissing her ass, she will want you like crazy. Keep everything light and playful. Keep it fun because these qualities are the best parts of you that she misses. After about two weeks of casual texting, you can start to flirt a bit, but not too heavily. STEP SIX: Don't take the bait. Wait for her to drunk dial you in the middle of the night, and then don't take the bait. I'm at Salon Posta to get my haircut with David. I want to talk a bit about haircut etiquette and make sure you aren't pissing off the people that are going to make you look sexy. Here is stylist and barber etiquette to follow:


Be on time. Stylists and barbers have schedules; you could disrupt their day if you're late. You can also rush them, and you want to get the best service possible.


Know what you want BEFORE you arrive. The people cannot read your mind and don't know what you want. You can help them by researching ahead of time and then asking for recommendations. Find styles that fit your hair texture, and bring pictures.


Take pictures. After the stylist finishes, have them take pictures of your hair's front, side, and back. That way, you have a reference if you go to somebody new.


Don't be inappropriate. You want to maintain a professional relationship. If you start to have appointments with the same person on a routine basis, you'll develop a relationship. You'll sit in their chair for 30-45 minutes and have conversations; sometimes, it can get personal. You don't want to be inappropriate, however. This makes everybody uncomfortable.


Put your phone away. Don't take calls because that's not appropriate, and it's disrespectful. If you're trying to talk, scroll, or text, your stylist can't give you a proper haircut if you move. You don't want your head jostling if they have a trimmer.


Be clean. If you went to the gym, take a shower before your appointment. And avoid wearing too much fragrance.


Use the restroom first. Ensure you use the bathroom before your appointment so you don't have to get up midway through.


Don't wait until the end. Communicate what you want when the appointment starts. If you wait until the end, they must go back and re-blend, almost like cutting your hair all over again. This could double the time.


Don't show up sick. If you're sick, stay home. Call in advance as well.


No hoverers. Don't have anyone come to your appointment and hover over your hair.


Make an appointment before you leave. Book an appointment based on how long your hair takes to grow. Many guys make the mistake of waiting too long, and sometimes, it's difficult to get in with your stylist.


Tip (properly)! Depending on the cost of your haircut, tip your stylist or barber between $5 and $20. Keep in mind that if you go too low, it can be offensive. If you go to a higher-end salon or barber, $20 is acceptable. If they take you and squeeze you in, you also need to increase the tip amount.

When you're young, it's easy to have incredible hair. You need to pick a great hairstyle and use the right products. It's the most hair you will have in your life, and bracing it is important. As you start to age, your hairline and hair density will change. You'll also start to go gray. If you do not control the situation, you can make mistakes that make you look even older. Don't neglect your aging hair by ...
Not managing going gray optimally. If you're not managing it properly, you can look older. If you pick an unnatural dark shade, it will make you look more awkward. It looks unnatural and stupid. You can reduce it by leaving a little bit, depending on how long the product is on your hair. Leaving a bit of salt and pepper is ideal. Gray hair has a different texture than your natural hair color; it's a bit more stiff and wiry. You'll need to learn how to manage and tame it.

Having dry hair. Many guys make the mistake of not adjusting their hair care routine as they age. Conditioner is a must to smooth and replenish nourishment and hydration in aging hair. This will allow it to lay more naturally and not frizz. Adjust your hair care routine to ensure your hair looks as good as possible. Take the Pete & Pedro Quiz to build a grooming routine.

Having flat and lifeless hair. As you age, your hair density will reduce, so you must maintain the volume. You can do that with a better haircut that adds layers and texture. You can use volumizing shampoos and volumizing conditioners. Also, add a pre-styler, such as Sea SALT Spray, into your routine. This will add weightless volume and boost your hair thickness. Texture Powder is also perfect for fine hair as it won't weigh your hair down.

Not minimizing forehead exposure. As your hairline changes, men often don't change hairlines to minimize the exposure of the forehead. One of the worst things you can do with a receding hairline is expose it. You need to choose a hairstyle that minimizes your forehead. Choose a hairstyle that gives a bit more coverage but not a comb-over. A light fringe or curtains can do a great job camouflaging a receding hairline. Other styles include the Caesar cut, French crop, and a style with piece-y separation.

Not dealing appropriately with hair loss. If you're losing your hair and don't want to use Minoxidil or have a transplant, trim it short. Grow facial hair to add balance and structure to your face. But if you want a transplant, make sure it looks natural and that you use a reputable company. The hairline should not go down too low or straight.

Choosing an immature hairstyle. Make sure you embrace a style for a mature man. Some styles are suited for the younger man and look great with more volume or textured hair. Younger styles can also look awkward on an older gentleman, making him look desperate and a bit sad.

Giving up. As they age, some men give up on their body, eating right, skin, and hair. They end up going to a barber with a cheap price in a strip mall and do not use products that are appropriate for their haircut. Make sure you use the right product for your hairstyle, which means talking to your barber or stylist about options.

Not modifying hair styling products. Too heavy or sticky products are not good for thinner hair, and you'll see more of the scalp. You also need to reduce the amount of product you're using.

Using the wrong products. Ensure you're using a high-quality product with a matte finish. Opt for Hair Clay or Texture Powder to make your hair look fuller and thicker. Knowing what products to use and how to style your hair as you age is key.

Wearing a Gucci belt says you're wildly insecure and desperate, begging for attention. A big gold Cuban link chain says that you could beat someone's ass. And an Apple watch says you're a huge dork. Make sure you choose the right option to look amazing. Remember that you don't have to spend hundreds or thousands of dollars to look good. A lot of the accessories that you wear to upgrade or elevate your style are affordable. Here are a few things that your accessories say about you

Piercings. If you have piercings in your nipples, belly button, or your genitals, it says that you're a freak and probably a sexual deviant. A nose ring says you're an f-boy and that you'll steal someone's girl because girls dig guys that are a bit edgier and bad boy. 

Belts. You look low-class and lazy if you're not wearing a belt and your pants are sagging. Don't let your underwear show. You need to pull your pants up and wear a belt. If you wear a Gucci belt, you look thirsty for attention, but it also lets people know you have money. The H belt is a little bit more subdued but is a bit douchey.

Watches. If you're not wearing a watch, you look unreliable and clueless. A stylish watch is a great conversation piece and an amazing accessory. Tech watches are not amazing or stylish but are more about function versus fashion. Tech watches also indicate you're not super awesome with style. Super expensive watches say you're a badass, get lots of p^ssy, and have lots of money. 

Necklaces. Shell chokers, like puka shells, make you look like you just got back from the beach and are 12 years old. Necklaces with leather straps, big pendants, or crucifixes make you look a bit low-class. 

Bracelets. A simple metal cuff looks amazing. Cartier makes some incredible but expensive lux bracelets for men, such as the one that looks like a wrapped nail. Big leather cups make you look like a redneck, a country music musician, or wear Ed Hardy jeans and a flannel shirt with sleeves ripped off. Beaded bracelets are a good segue. The bracelets you wear boil down to the overall aesthetic that you're going for.

Rings. If you wear a silicone wedding band, people think you're into working out regularly. If you wear multiple rings on a single hand, you look like a mob boss, especially if it's a pinky ring. Thumb rings should not be worn. Use extreme caution if you wear a ring on any other finger than your index finger.

Hats. Baseball hats are okay if they're not dirty. I've changed my mind about never wearing your hat backward. If you're going to wear it backward, realize it will send a message that you're useful and younger. Trucker hats are a bit more rugged. 

Backpacks. In general, backpacks make you look a bit younger. Some are more sleek and stylish and come in leather and different fabrics. You can upgrade the quality and, therefore, the aesthetic of your backpack. A bag of higher quality sends a message that you have some extra money, and you're not afraid to spend it.

Glasses. Glasses can make you look instantly cool or dorky. Certain types will make you look like Uncle Barry. A simple or no frame will indicate you're not really into style. Think of glasses as accessories you're lucky enough to wear on your face. You need to find something with more structure and substance.  Also, plenty of brands won't break the bank -- Glasses USA and Warby Parker are two of my favorites. Sports sunglasses have come back into style, similar to the mullet and mustache. They make you look like you're playful and fun and that you don't take yourself too seriously. Great sunglasses options are Ray-Ban, Wayfair, Aviator, or Clubmaster.

Bags. A cross-body bag demonstrates here a bit more youthful, on-trend, and in style.

Wallets. They can either send the message that you're cool or a lazy slob. Ensure it's not packed with receipts and cards, making you look unorganized. Look for something sleek and minimal to carry in your front pocket. The brand Coach has a bunch of incredible wallets with amazing options.

A lot of us feel ugly or unattractive because we don't look like what we see on social media. The good news is that you have some advantages if you don't look like the 1%. I want to go over some powerful reasons why being ugly is better than being attractive.
If you're not part of that 1%, you have these advantages

Greater success. Data shows that if you're attractive, you'll probably make more money, but attractive people do not have the motivation to do amazing things. Think about Mark Zuckerberg and Facebook. Think about Elon Musk. Think about Jeff Bezos. Even think about Bill Gates.

Stronger self-identity. Instead of going out and searching for validation through other people telling you that you look good or that you're hot, you're forced to analyze yourself and become more comfortable in your own skin regardless of your appearance.

Deeper connections. People get to know you for who you are, which they love. It's not because you're pretty or popular.

Not obsessed with plastic surgery. You're not obsessed with plastic surgery or doing stupid things to your body that are unhealthy to look better or fit in. A lot of men decide to take TRT, which ruins their bodies.

Learned resilience. You're tougher than people who are good-looking because, many times, they've gotten a lot of handouts. You may have had to fend for yourself or fight for yourself. You've earned everything and faced rejection. You don't rely on external validation to build yourself into who you're destined to be. You're forced to be stronger and better when you grow up with adversity. You've become a well-rounded person who does not rely on external validation for feelings of confidence, security, etc.

Self-sufficient and intrinsically motivated. You don't rely on praise or people telling you you're awesome. You build yourself up by doing things that you enjoy and working on the things that you enjoy working on. You develop your mind, hobbies, business, and/or career.

Aging without freaking out. You're not devastated when you lose your good looks when aging. If you're used to having a great body or being amazing-looking, your ego is destroyed when that fades. Looks are a depreciating asset, but money, your mind, and those you love aren't.

Controlling what can be controlled. If you're a bit unattractive and grow a beard, boom, automatically, you will strengthen your jaw and look much better. If you're well groomed, you can cultivate your appearance. You can nurture your skin as well. You can't control your bone structure, height, or even your voice, but you can control many aspects to improve your physical appearance drastically.

Grab a trash bag and come with me to your closet. I need to purge my shoe collection from time to time, and as all men should do, we should not be wearing some of the shoes that younger dudes are wearing or that we've been wearing way too long. Here's what you should purge. Hopefully, you don't have any of these shoes

Ugly shoes. These shoes were a bad buying decision. All of us make these bad decisions from time to time. We might think they're awesome at the time, but we probably end up not wearing them.

Shoes you never wore. It doesn't matter how much you spent on them; you shouldn't have them in your wardrobe if you never wore them.

Sandals/flip-flops + funky feet. If you're not going to be foot-responsible, you need to toss them because your toes are showing. You need to make sure your toes are not messed up and nasty.

Shoes that don't break in. Even if you thought they would break in, and they don't, you need to get rid of them. If they're not comfortable, you don't need to wear them.

Pointy toe box. If the toe box is too pointy, they're not in style. You need to find shoes with a more natural toe box. It's not overly dramatic (not too pointy or square). A cap toe is another option with more detail but a natural toe box.

Boat shoes. If you're an adult and still have a pair of these, you need to eliminate them. This includes Sperry Topsiders, the first modern boat shoe.

Flashy sneakers. Get rid of those shoes, saying, 'Look at me!'

Toms. Toms suck.

Dirty shoes. If you're stylish, you need to take care of your shoes. If your laces are worn out, gnarled, or frayed, replace them. If your shoes are dirty, clean them. If the soles are scuffed, fix them. The shoes you're wearing should be presentable; if not, toss them.

Hey Dudes. If you're an adult dude rocking those, you're not stylish. They are zero-stylish.

Functional dress shoes. These dress shoes have an athletic sole on the bottom but a business upper. This is like the mullet of shoes, and they don't work. It's a hybrid shoe that sucks.

Dad sneakers. The whole trend of the big bulky monster shoes sucks. If you're a young dude, that's fine, but they're expensive and going out of style. Even if you're young, don't waste your money.

Pricey shoes. These super expensive white minimal leather sneakers aren't that premium.

Stinky shoes. If you can smell your shoes or they're not fresh, toss them. Don't stick them in the freezer. Get new shoes. Do not wear your shoes barefoot, either. Wear no-show socks or sprinkle powder inside your shoe to absorb odor and sweat.

Crocs. Many young dudes are rocking Crocs again, and they're not cool or stylish. Avoid them.

Sneakers with everything. I'm not just talking about running shoes. I'm talking about wearing any sneakers with everything.

Mismatched dress shoes + outfit. Certain dress shoes have certain levels of dressiness. A super shiny shoe is a bit more dressy and formal. You can't dress them down with jeans; it won't work.

Super trendy dress shoes. Don't wear dress shoes that are super trendy or overly pointy.

Fake leather. Fake leather construction is cheap and plastic. They look cheap, and the shoes won't last as long as leather.

MY RELIGIOUS ROOTS
I want to start from the beginning by saying that my family is Italian and super Catholic. My grandmother is the most Catholic woman you've ever met. She was always doing her rosaries and going to church. My mom did not want to instill that in me because she had a lot of questions and wanted me to form my own opinions, so I never went to Catholic Sunday School. My dad is a Buddhist and has been since he was ten, so I was exposed to that. My best friend is Jewish. His father was a Lutheran minister, so I was also exposed to those as well. And then I moved to Georgia, which is in the Bible Belt, where I started dating a Baptist woman. So, I was exposed to that, too. 

RESEARCH AND STUDY
I started studying and wanted to know what these religions have in common and why certain religions oppose others. Why do some religions think you're going to hell if you're not their religion? I wanted to know if there is hell. Is there a heaven? What does it look like? I've done my research. One thing I can say is religion has a cornerstone of faith. It's believing in something in the absence of proof. And for me, I want to believe, but unfortunately, when you see a lot of suffering or have friends that pass away or babies with cancer, the whole 'God has a plan' thing goes out the window. At least it did for me. The other frame of thought that went out the window was my ex-girlfriend, who's Baptist, telling me that if someone is gay, they're going to hell. I told her that's not reality, and she said it is. She said the Bible says so, and I said it doesn't matter if that's what the Bible says; it's wrong. This made me start to read the Bible from cover to cover, both the Old and New Testaments. She was saying things such as if you don't accept Jesus Christ as your Lord and Savior, then you're going to hell. That led me to think about all of the people and tribes that never were exposed to Christianity and questioned the notion that they were going to go to hell. And she said yes and that they had a choice. I said that they didn't. I also mentioned Buddhists and Asians who have different religions, and she said they'll all go to hell, too. I thought that was crazy.

SOME OF MY CONCLUSIONS
I started a deep dive into religion to understand and learn about these different things. That's when a peace came over me because I realized all religions relay a similar message. They use different words for different things, whether referring to God, Allah, enlightenment, reincarnation, heaven, hell, and more. There are words for the same thing, and everybody preaches the same message: be good, do the best job possible, live a moral and righteous life, treat people kindly, and help people. I don't believe that there is a supreme being who picks winners and losers, that you're blessed or not, or that you'll get things because you believe or not. I think we control our lives and destiny. We control our faith and future. I believe there's a God because you can see it in beauty and kindness. Why are there over ten thousand different religions if it's all black and white? It doesn't make sense or add up. Religion is such a challenging topic to discuss because so many different religions exist, and if you're cerebral, you'll start to question. Sometimes, people take issue with others questioning religion, which is a shame. I wish I could have more conversations about life and the universe with people. What else doesn't make sense is people hating you because you believe in something different from them. The more people I lose and the more suffering I see, the more I question things. It all boils down to being a good person‚Äîhelping people. I just wanted to talk and tell you my perspective because I feel more than one of you is out there that this video spoke to. I hope it helps and permits you to think outside the box.

Whoever said money can't buy happiness didn't build their dream gym in their basement. My new Alpha M. home gym is so badass and perfect. It's a thousand square feet of unadulterated muscle-building, body-blasting amazingness. I just wanted to tell you about the pieces I put together, which cost me about $60K for everything from the rubberized flooring to the StairMaster to other pieces that made my dream come true. This is a knuckle bump to the little 12-year-old Alpha who started working out in his basement, which was my best decision ever. 

Since I started working out at 12, everything has revolved around fitness. Fitness has been my constant, allowing me to overcome adversity and feel confident. So, when I was building my new house, I aimed to build the most badass gym, and I did. I'm proud of this accomplishment more than the house. The space is a thousand square feet, which you enter through iron doors. All items in the gym are matte black. All the equipment is Hoist except for the power rack, treadmill, and StairMaster. The dumbbells and barbells are from Tag. It's all high-quality, which I felt was important when building my dream gym.

First up is the Peloton bike. Also, I am proud of the StairMaster, which is the most kick-ass cardio (I love and hate it). I also have a commercial treadmill which is quite different than what you can find at Dick's Sporting Goods or Walmart.

I also bought a rack of preset barbells that go from 20-110 pounds and a rack of dumbbells from 5 to 75 pounds. My gym features a leg press, which is the proper leg equipment I wanted. Legs are hard to do without the proper equipment. Sure, you can do walking lunges, but I absolutely love a great leg press. The centerpiece of the gym is the functional trainer. I also got a power rack with all the different adjustments and weights. My gym also includes a bench and a special piece of equipment with which I can do dips, pull-ups, and climbing grips. I got a hamstring curl and leg extension combo to add to the leg equipment.

I also wanted a sauna for my dream gym, so I added it to an auxiliary closet with plenty of room. It can reach temperatures of about 200¬∞ F.

LEVEL UP
Once you nail down these elements, the other pieces aren't as complicated. A simple and quick way to dress up denim in a casual setting is with sneakers and a t-shirt. Then, throw a suede bomber on top. It instantly elevates the look. Another option is to throw on a nice jacket or outerwear, such as a driving jacket or pea coat. A navy pea coat instantly dresses up the jeans. If you're wearing a more casual look, wear a nicer jacket to elevate the aesthetic instantly. It keeps it casual cool. A field jacket is also a great option that quickly elevates the aesthetic but is a little more casual. Throwing on a sports coat or a suit jacket looks bad, in my opinion, when you wear it with jeans and sneakers. The cardigan sweater is another great outerwear option to elevate the aesthetic with sneakers and denim instantly

NEXT LEVEL
Changing out the sneakers for brown loafers and wearing medium-wash denim with a white polo elevates the aesthetic to the next level. The cardigan sweater with the outfit is absolute perfection. Change out the cardigan for a sports coat, but do not wear your suit jacket with jeans because it looks like a suit jacket. You want a blazer that is less constructed and more casual. I'm wearing a Maverick Blazer, which can be worn with slacks or chinos. Changing out the white polo for a black polo and then changing to black jeans and black loafers is a clean, simple, and sexy combination. Throw on a camel-colored jacket or another cool badass jacket to take it to another level. Sweaters can change the aesthetic of jeans as long as you combine them properly with the right shoes and boots. I returned to my medium-wash denim and combined it with a cable knit turtleneck sweater. Adding a pair of black Chelsea boots dresses up the outfit. Boots and jeans go together perfectly, and if I wear jeans in the winter, I will rock boots with them. They look amazing, whether Chukka or Chelsea boots, and suede adds richness and texture to the denim. Switching out the turtleneck for a v-neck sweater is also an amazing option. Long-sleeve polos are a devastatingly perfect option for dressing up jeans. I could have chosen loafers or boots but opted for suede sneakers with a brown sole instead. They work really well with this outfit. White button-downs and sports coats with jeans are a classic look but always opt for a solid white, black, or navy shirt. Patterns are a bit tricky if you're going to be pairing the outfit with a jacket. If you want a patterned button-down, opt for a solid jacket, making matching easy. Conversely, you could try a heavy textured sports coat with interesting patterns or textures combined with a simple white button-up shirt and jeans. Also, stylish loafers paired with that outfit is a great option. Avoid wearing sneakers; instead, wear loafers or a dressy Chelsea boot.

I've been embarrassed to admit this, but something happened to me when I was 20. I want to share it because it's the worst-case scenario; it's what we all fear when we start to have insecurity about relationships. But it's also worth sharing because it presents the possibility of getting over it. Once you're insecure about a relationship, it can become all-consuming if you don't have the tools to get it in check. You can potentially ruin an amazing relationship. I have used these tools and tricks to prevent relationship insecurity from ruling my relationships. Here are the tools and tricks to maintain a secure relationship:


Don't breach trust. Don't snoop! If you start snooping, it's like a Pandora's box that's been open. Don't break trust.


Stop trying to read the other person's mind. You need to ask them if something is bothering them. Hopefully, your relationship is good and healthy, and you can communicate and work through issues but do not pester or try to get a different answer.


Don't confuse imagination with reality. Sometimes, if you're insecure, you build things up in your head and imagine certain things. You can read into things, leading to bad behavior like snooping. Snooping is never acceptable.


The past doesn't dictate the future. Just because somebody was crappy to you or cheated on you doesn't mean that the next person will. Don't ruin a relationship because of something from the past; don't accuse them of things and go down the rabbit hole. It's a slippery slope, especially if you start snooping. It's a breach of trust and confidence. Once it's lost, it's difficult to come back from.


Don't allow your gut to rule your emotions or make bad decisions. If something's not right, ask. Follow up with them, but do not pester them. Do not build up something in your head or make things up that will sabotage your relationship. If you have an issue, fix it to continue with your relationship. Don't bring it up again. If you later have a fight, don't bring it up again because that's unacceptable. It's dirty fighting. Allow it to be over. If you cannot heal, you need to end the relationship.


Don't micromanage. You can't micromanage somebody because the relationship can't grow or breathe. You have to allow the person to have friends and do their thing. Do not be consumed with the possibilities or worries. That can eat you alive.


Make yourself a priority. When we get into relationships, we often become obsessive and focus too much on the relationship or the other person. We need to focus on ourselves so we don't lose our identity, hobbies, and personal growth. We want to feel still good about ourselves, so we must take care of ourselves and prioritize ourselves. No amount of love will prevent somebody from doing something if they're broken.


You can't prevent things from happening. If they cheat, lie, or leave you, shame on them. If they don't want to be with you anymore, it's their problem. No amount of love, caring, or affection can fix a cheater. On the flip side, no amount of attention and love can prevent somebody from doing it. They were pre-designed or hardwired to do that. They have issues they need to deal with and do the deep work. They're going to seek attention and affection from outside sources constantly. If they don't want to be with you, let them go. Build a beautiful relationship that's happy and healthy.

Today is a little old-school Alpha M. etiquette tutorial about autos. Specifically, we're talking about the do's and don'ts when you own a car and also when you're a passenger. I feel like every single one of you should follow these. Here's car etiquette for everyone:

Don't drive distracted. Do not text and drive! It's how quickly something could happen, and if you're distracted even for a second by looking at your phone, bang!

Never drink and drive, even if you think you're fine after consuming. With all the different rideshare apps, there's no excuse. If you're going out and you know there's going to be alcohol, don't even take your car. If you get there and then drink cocktails, get a ride home. You can leave your car.

Don't drive a car you can't afford. Many people think they need a super sexy, badass car, but having a super affordable car is really what it's about. Just keep it clean.

Keep the outside clean. It doesn't matter what ride you're rolling; you must keep it clean.

Don't park like an asshole. Don't take up multiple spots when you park. Also, do not park in a handicap spot.

Keep the inside clean. Do not have clutter in your car. Also, make sure it's not dirty and dusty. It should not have a disgusting film all over it. Your car needs to smell good, too. But don't spray cologne in your car or use sprays like Febreze. I like to use Drift, which makes my car smell amazing.

Don't drive like an ass. Tailgating, speeding, cutting off people, and yelling at others are all bad ideas. Don't be stupid! Make sure you use your turn signals and follow the road rules. It's all pretty simple with zipper merging, four-way stops, having an ambulance or emergency vehicle pass, funeral processions, and more. It's about respect.

Use Bluetooth respect. If you get a phone call while you're in your car and it goes through the speaker system via Bluetooth, I have respect for the color and let them know they're on speaker. This also helps other people in the car because they could end up saying things they shouldn't. It's all about courtesy.

Don't be a disrespectful passenger. (1) Don't be a backseat driver, even though you may think you drive better. (2) Don't eat in someone else's car. It's disrespectful unless you ask. Another time might be when you're on a road trip. Make sure you're super careful and don't spill anything. And don't ever toss trash out and litter!

Pay attention! Don't you stop lights as a time to check your phone. These lights are on timers, and you can mess up the system by not paying attention and taking your turn.

Use rideshare instead of driving high. There's no excuse these days for driving impaired because we have a ride at our fingertips. Paying for a ride is much cheaper than a DUI.

Be a gentleman. Open the door for your visitor or guest. Wait for them to get into the car before shutting the door.

Getting compliments feels amazing, and you can wear specific items that guarantee you get ten times more compliments.


Tan or camel-colored driving jackets automatically attract more compliments because they are different, rich, and look amazing.


I've been wearing rings for years, and it doesn't matter which ring I wear; I always get compliments because they're bigger and chunkier. Rings are a great way to express your individual style.


Even if your watch is not super expensive, people still notice. Just wear a watch (that's not a tech watch).


Retrospects are the sunglasses that I own that were most complimented. What I've noticed is that no matter what sunglasses I have owned, they all have some gradient, and they're the ones that get the most compliments.


Anytime I wear a bomber jacket, whether suede or puffer, I am asked where I got it. My latest came from Thursday Boots.


I always get a ton of compliments when I wear my leather jacket. The trick is not to wear one that's basic and boring. The one I love is from All Saints. Check out my examples in the video. Although not a leather jacket, my simple denim jacket from H&M, which cost me $30, always gets many compliments.


I have owned hundreds, if not thousands, of fragrances, and nothing gets me more compliments than Creed Aventus. It's crazy expensive at $400 a bottle, so I recreated one for $50. Pete & Pedro's REBEL is affordable and crushes it!


I've gotten a ton of compliments on brown suede chukkas. The bottom line is that brown-colored shoes will get you a ton of compliments. Suede, in general, will always get me a ton of compliments, whether it's boots, sneakers, jackets, or otherwise. I get a lot of compliments on brown minimal sneakers and brown boots. Instead of dark brown, go with something a bit later, like chestnut.


My navy pinstriped tailored suit is a compliment grabber. The pants fit me flawlessly, and the jacket fits me amazingly. The color is incredible, and the pinstripes make it more special. Another detail to look for is the lapel, which is more like a Tom Ford peak lapel. A navy blue suit is a must-have, but it's even better with a chalk stripe or pinstripe. I got mine from Suit Supply and had it tailored.


Wear colors outside of the box. If you go for a color that's a bit fresh and bright, you automatically get noticed. Wear colors that work with your skin's undertone and hair color. The general rule is that if you're very light/white or your hair is one, stay away from dark or bright colors. Go with more muted and subdued. The darker your skin tone and the darker your hair, the easier time you'll have wearing brighter colors. Yellows, blues, reds, and pinks will look amazing on you. And if you have black skin, it's game over -- you literally can wear anything and look incredible.


I get so many compliments on my tortoiseshell glasses because they're not boring or basic. They stand out in the right way. Tortoiseshell is an incredible option for eyewear, whether sunglasses or simple frames. The high contrast between the acetate will automatically get you noticed.


I get more compliments from both men and women on my earrings. I know a lot of people think I look like a huge douche, but I don't care. The takeaway is jewelry. If you're wearing a cool necklace, bracelet, ring, or watch, you're automatically setting yourself apart from most guys because most guys are boring and basic. By upgrading and elevating your accessories style, you'll automatically get compliments.
