videos.title: 20 Millie Bobby Brown Blooper Scenes
videos.description:
When you start working as young as she did, the blooper count is through the roof. Millie Bobby Brown: a jokester on set, a wicked talent, and an all-around goofy human. We‚Äôre taking a look back over her best bloopers throughout the years in everything from Stranger Things to Enola Holmes to the Godzilla franchise to some of Millie‚Äôs earliest on-screen appearances! 
When the roller skates broke out on the set of Stranger Things, it meant there were going to be a whole lot of bloopers while the actress got the hang of using them! When she was filming Enola Holmes, her costume didn‚Äôt restrict her in the least when it came to starting slapping fights with her co-stars! If there was a flub on set, Millie usually knew how to make the best of it, offering some pretty sassy improv! There were times when Millie said stuff her co-stars did NOT wanna hear. There were plenty of stumbles on the Stranger Things set with so many stunts, but one of Millie‚Äôs most embarrassing moments was when she fell simply walking down a hill. 
Then there were the days that Millie just TOTALLY blanked on set, unable to come up with a line to save her life. Maybe she was too busy thinking about all the flossing she wanted to do on set - and no, not the kind you‚Äôre thinking of. We‚Äôve even got a behind-the-scenes moment from one of the very first TV shows Millie did! She may not always be perfect on set, but she‚Äôs definitely a whole lot of fun!

videos.title: Stranger Things Season 4 Behind The Scenes
videos.description:
Season 4 of Stranger Things has really upped the ante, and proved itself as one of the show's best seasons. Creating a show as big as Stranger Things is no easy task. There was a lot of work going on behind the scenes to bring the show to life. Between recreating Southern California in another state, to coordinating massive scenes with crazy stunts, everyone gave a hundred and ten percent to help create this season. That being said, there was also a lot of goofing off and shenanigans between the cast members. Millie Bobby Brown and Noah Schnaap in particular had a lot of hilarious stories about their on set experiences while filming. Can you guess which one of them got pelted by water balloons?

Creating the right look and aesthetic was extremely important for the Stranger Things team. Vecna is one of the coolest monsters we have seen on the show, and a ton of hard work went into creating his look. The prosthetics team had their hands full, as they applied a whopping amount of prosthetics. It‚Äôs almost hard to believe how many individual pieces were applied to actor Jamie Campbell. It‚Äôs no wonder he spent so long in the makeup chair!

Sometimes the best behind the scenes moments have nothing to do with the show, and come purely from the chemistry all the actors have with each other. Like which cast members competed in a fruit by the foot challenge?

Which behind the scenes moment from Stranger Things season 4 is your favorite? Let us know down below in the comments!

videos.title: Behind The Making of Jurassic World Dominion
videos.description:
Building a Jurassic world is a massive undertaking - and the team behind Jurassic World Dominion didn‚Äôt hold back in the slightest. 
First, we‚Äôve gotta talk about the dinosaurs. Not only were their real dinosaur puppets and animatronics on the set - we‚Äôre talking full-size, breathing dinosaurs that the actors would get up close and personal with. Not only were they large in size - there are more dinosaurs in Jurassic World Dominion than in any other film! 
The actors were required to really bring their a-game - even when it came to doing some scenes that weren‚Äôt the most comfortable. Let‚Äôs just say one actor spent a whole lot of time soaking wet! Oh and we should mention - there are dinos in the snow. One actor in particular really got up close and personal with the snow. Filming wound up feeling a bit more like being at an amusement park! 
Jurassic World Dominion brings together the best of both worlds, honoring the legacy that started all those years ago in the first Jurassic Park film, to now, wrapping up the franchise with a film that brings the whole family together. 
Dinosaurs did take up a significant part of their one hundred and sixty-five million dollar budget, but that also covered all the pyrotechnics, intense stunts, and giant fans needed to amp up all the action. Oh, and in case you were wondering, yes, there is an EPIC car chase - we even get to see one of the lead actors speeding around on a motorbike!

videos.title: 15 Painful Stranger Things Scenes To Film
videos.description:
Stranger Things is an intense TV show so it‚Äôs no surprise to hear that its young cast struggled to film it. It was downright painful at times. From emotional pain, like missing your friends to vomiting and stingy-burning pain, the struggles this cast endured were very specific to this show. Millie Bobby Brown, who plays Eleven, is not one to go easy on herself, and this led her down a few dark paths. One had her collapse out of sheer exhaustion and another made her vomit. Only one of these moments made it into the show, we bet you can guess! She was also contending with a broken knee which couldn‚Äôt have been a whole lot of fun. She watched from the sidelines as her stunt double frolicked in The Upside Down. Dacre Montgomery who plays Billy Hargrove is almost as intense as Millie. He shattered a window in one improvised moment but wasn‚Äôt as lucky as his co-star. His moment to shatter the glass ceiling just wasn‚Äôt right. Dacre had a deep dark secret hidden right beneath his millions of prosthetics. Both Noah Schnapp and Joe Keery‚Äôs eyes were burning thanks to some costume department choices. Running around as a Demogorgon sounds like fun‚Ä¶ in theory. But in reality, it was very difficult to navigate the creature suit. And so the Demogorgon was replaced. Yes, Stranger Things sure has dealt with its fair share of overwhelming incidents. There are just too many to list. So why not give the video a watch?

videos.title: The Making Of Chip And Dale Rescue Rangers
videos.description:
The legendary Chip and Dale are back - but you‚Äôve NEVER seen them like this before. This production brings together the best of animation history with a new twist - and some new talents.
John Mulaney and Andy Samberg are the first to voice Chip and Dale in decades - and they brought a whole new and brilliant energy. Lots of time was in the booth and connecting with each other to bring the relationship together. They weren‚Äôt alone though. Some very special guests helped to show them just how to nail it. One of their co-stars was on set filming every day, but their experience was pretty different from the norm since they were pretty much the only actor on set all the time, acting opposite different models and markers! 
One of the best parts of this movie is spotting just how many different characters make it to the screen - especially beloved Disney classics AND characters from outside the animated Disney world. However, it wasn‚Äôt easy to make it all happen. The lawyers in this production had a VERY important role in making this a reality. This movie has been a long time coming since the production team had to jump through all kinds of hoops to convince Disney to agree to make the film and of course, to fund it. One very short clip featuring Seth Rogen was what sold Disney on the film and the rest was history - and that clip happens to have been sent straight to Disney Plus, meaning it might end up being released as a special feature! This blast from the past will fill all your nostalgic needs while reminding us of the rich and incredible history of animation.

videos.title: Harry Potter Actors Reveal Most Difficult Scenes To Film
videos.description:
The adventures in the world of Harry Potter were nothing short of magical and chaotic! Throughout all the films, the Harry Potter actors faced their worst fears, performed intense stunts bravely, and got through some VERY long filming days. 
Filming the first movie was tough because of just how young all the kids were. Throw live animals into the mix who weren‚Äôt always on their best behavior, and you‚Äôve got a recipe for disaster. The young ones were often tough to work with simply because they couldn‚Äôt keep focused for long enough, often giggling throughout takes - once it got so bad that the actor speaking had to do so from across the room to try and keep the kids cool! Spoiler alert: They couldn‚Äôt stop the giggling. The only thing more chaotic than the children's actors were the animal actors who made set life a nuisance for everyone.
Then there were the emotionally tough scenes to film - from Emma Watson being tortured by Helena Bonham Carter to Harry losing one of the most important people in his life. Emma Watson, Rupert Grint, and Daniel Radcliffe all had to overcome some very awkward feelings that came up about the kisses they had to film with each other. 
The stunts made for some exciting and painful days. Daniel Radcliffe was close to drowning, meanwhile, Robert Pattinson was seriously hurting after performing a stunt! No matter the feat, these actors overcame it to make sure the magic made it to our screen!

videos.title: Marvel Actors Who Injured Their Costars On Set
videos.description:
Movies may be simulated events but that doesn‚Äôt mean making them doesn‚Äôt come with real risks. And Marvel movies are chocked full of moments where the actors probably should have subbed in their stunt doubles. The actors have suffered smacks, kicks, punches, knees to the chest, whips to the face, and the list goes on. There is one actor in particular who managed to injure everyone in the cast he had a fight scene with. Don‚Äôt get in an elevator with him. Chris Evans, Scarlett Johansson and Anthony Mackie will all testify that working with that guy would lead to a ton of bumps and bruises. But that‚Äôs what you get for hiring a real fighter! Benedict Cumberbatch took a boot to the chest after a lack of communication and nearly a dozen failed attempts at a stunt. Hayley Atwell was one of the worst when it came to injuring stunt people on the set of Peggy Carter. Two words: lead pipe. Simu Liu, lead in Shang Chi, took a real hit thanks to his nervous co-star‚Äôs first attempt at a fight scene with him. Masks are terrible. They completely take away your peripheral vision, never drive with one on it‚Äôs a bad idea. Tom Holland got injured and Chadwick Boseman injured someone else thanks to their inability to see. Poor Tom Hiddleston had to work with the god-like Chris Hemsworth and he suffered for it. But despite all of the injuries the cast endured, we‚Äôre pretty sure that sweet paycheck made up for it. Plus, battle scars are cool.

There are more than a few occasions where our favorite swashbucklers just can‚Äôt get a specific line - or keep a serious face.
Pirates has an endless blooper reel - and we all know what that means. Not only do we get to see the guilty persons responsible for flubbing scenes - but we get to laugh along with them. Sometimes things just don‚Äôt go as planned or the story can be veered off the path with one improvised line - but all these situations made its way back to the main story. We mean - every time Johnny flubs a line - or acts a fool as Sparrow - that‚Äôs pretty much extra training to stay in the quirky character. Making even some of the most serious actors out there break - is no easy task. So obviously someone was doing their job right. 
An actor has to roll with the punches of a scene when things go wrong - but in this case - there were just too many weird things happening on set to stay in the moment. Although - even the most complex sword tricks needed a few times to get right - and those final sighs of relief were needed to make a perfect final cut. So keep a close eye out for the troublemaker - we‚Äôve got a little challenge for you in this video.

videos.title: 15 Johnny Depp Painful Character Transformations
videos.description:
He‚Äôs a master of whacky characters and being a total chameleon on screen - over the years Johnny Depp has made a brilliant career of embodying roles that seem out of this world and has given some legendary performances. 
Physically, Depp has undergone plenty of painful transformations to do everything from existing in Wonderland as the Mad Hatter, to roughing it on the seas during all the time he‚Äôs spent filming Pirates of the Caribbean as Jack Sparrow. The actor looked unrecognizable when he lived in the land of endless candy - and his particular voice was one of the most jarring aspects of the transformation! 
Johnny Depp‚Äôs time in the wizarding world saw the actor committing very intensely to it - he fully cut and dyed his hair just for the part - but immediately after he finished filming, the actor had his hair color updated again before even leaving the set. 
While Johnny Depp is known mainly as an actor - he has had his turn in singing roles - most notably, he took on the incredibly vocally-challenging role of Sweeney Todd in the musical of the same name. His physical transformation required hours in the makeup chair, but his vocal transformation took hours working with a singing teacher in a studio before ever arriving to set! 
On his way to becoming a globally-recognized star, Depp established iconic roles through wickedly painful transformations - like the terrifying Edward Scissorhands. Depp did visit the vampire genre later in their career in the film Dark Shadows, which saw plenty of vampire-like makeup and prosthetics involved. 
No matter what was required, Depp never failed to rise to the challenge when it came to bringing these characters to life.

Does anyone have some love potion? Whether or not magic was involved, there was plenty of romance and secret crushing on the Harry Potter set. Daniel Radcliffe‚Äôs crush happened to be on a MUCH older woman in the cast - and he even confessed his love to her in quite a cheekily written note, given on their last day on set together. Emma Watson was a crush for many of the actors on set - including some who were almost sibling-like to her! The actress had her fair share of crushes as well. One that was pretty major - but that didn‚Äôt stop her from having eyes for another boy that would end up working on set and bringing a whole lot of handsome to the table. 
When two actors are going to be kissing, feelings can often get into the mix - and in the case of Ron and Lavender - there were some definite feelings. As for Harry and Cho chang - well Katie Leung wasn‚Äôt opposed to kissing for multiple takes.
While he was playing the lead role and was the star of a franchise, Daniel Radcliffe could still be quite shy, so when he was caught in the middle of a practical joke on set while VERY close to a crush of his, he was understandably pretty bummed. 
No matter what kind it was, there is no question, the Harry Potter set was FULL of love.

videos.title: 15 Improvised Scenes Tom Holland Came Up With On The Spot
videos.description:
Tom Holland is a super talent that continues to prove himself as one of the best actors currently working. One of his many skills is his ability to improvise and create amazing moments out of thin air. From his many turns as Spider-Man in the Marvel Cinematic Universe, to his portrayal of Nathan Drake in Uncharted, Tom has gone off script many times. He seems to have amazing chemistry with everyone he works with, especially his Spider-Man co-stars. His improvisation skills are actually what helped him land the role of Spider-Man. Even though he was warned not to improvise during his audition, he did so anyway when performing alongside Robert Downey Jr. They carried that same energy into the movies, where they have multiple scenes together that feature improvised banter between the two characters.

The scenes between Peter, Ned, and MJ in the Spider-Man movies work so well because of the chemistry the three actors have together. It helped them improvise during many different scenes, which lent a natural feel to the films. And when Andrew Garfield and Tobey Maguire showed up to film No Way Home, it was as if the three actors were old friends. Tom riffed with the other two Spider-Men and created multiple improvised moments that became extremely memorable scenes. This included the emotional goodbye between the three that ended with a big group hug.

Which improvised Tom Holland moment is your favorite? Let us know down in the comments, and thanks for stopping by at The Things!

videos.title: 25 Avengers Scenes With And Without Special Effects
videos.description:
We are taking a look, primarily, at the scenes from the Avengers movies with and without CGI. The gap between projects really accentuates just how much CGI has developed over the past couple of decades. It‚Äôs honestly pretty mind-blowing. From Jon Favreau completely lacking confidence in designing a digital Iron Man in the first movie in 2008 to where Avengers: Endgame left off eleven years later, it‚Äôs pretty impeccable to see the evolution. The filmmaking tech had to evolve with Stark Tech. And these advancements to the Iron Man suit advanced Ultron and Ultron‚Äôs army as well. Imagine Marvel‚Äôs struggle if they started with Ultron and not Iron Man. It literally would have been impossible (or at least super expensive and bulky or incredibly paired down). Robert Downey Junior also had a genius idea that was implemented. The Hulk also got a few updates which are what led to Smart Hulk even being able to exist. Have you seen what The Rabbit‚Ä¶ We mean, the raccoon, Rocket Raccoon looks like without CGI? It‚Äôs pretty freaky. Just kidding, it‚Äôs just Sean Gunn hobbling around but it‚Äôs hilarious to watch! Impressive he‚Äôs even able to take himself seriously. Speaking of seriously, don‚Äôt take us too seriously we got super psyched about some green and blue screens near the end. We apologize in advance for that, it‚Äôs pretty lame to have two whole entries dedicated to screens. Can you guess which super suits were completely CGI? And no, we aren‚Äôt talking about Rocket or Groot or any other humanoid creature. Prepare to feel all the feels when we recontextualize Peter and Tony hugging. All that and more ahead!

videos.title: 15 Embarrassing Scenes Elizabeth Olsen Had To Film As Scarlet Witch
videos.description:
Elizabeth Olsen is always looking fierce as the Scarlet Witch, AKA Wanda Maximoff. That is at least the impression we get seeing her on the big screen in the Marvel movies, but behind the scenes, she isn‚Äôt always so calm, cool, and collected. In some of her most intense scenes, the actress made some awkward stumbles, causing more injury to herself than anyone else! One of Olsen‚Äôs worst mess-ups on set wound up being enjoyed by the crew and cast on repeat - they even watched the stumble in slow motion! 
Olsen has an incredible relationship on and off-screen with her co-star Paul Bettany, but one unfortunate on-set incident led to their very first argument EVER - it even has a name: Snotgate. Bettany was responsible for making her laugh in the middle of multiple scenes. While the two actors are very close - Olsen has been far more used to Bettany as Vision, so when she saw him in the flesh there were some seriously weird vibes. Another co-star Olsen grew close with was her on-screen brother, Aaron Taylor-Johnson. These two could have a lot of fun on set - resulting in multiple messed-up takes. 
The Scarlet Witch has a very different experience when it comes to doing stunts. Her hand gestures and choreo are impressive on-screen, but her co-stars have made fun of her plenty of times because of just how wild she looks while doing the actions. One actor even referred to her as ‚Äúbeing at a rave.‚Äù The actress has even shocked herself with her wildly bendy back.  
No matter how many times she fumbled or flubbed, Elizabeth Olsen always managed to bring the fire and power that made her the Scarlet Witch.

videos.title: The Voices Behind The Bad Guys
videos.description:
The Bad Guys is jam-packed with a solid cast of actors. Most haven‚Äôt done a whole lot of voice acting, except for Alex Borstein. The cast was able to record together, luckily. After the few years voice actors have had, we‚Äôre sure they‚Äôre glad to be in a studio playing off of each other. Sam Rockwell‚Äôs been in another animated movie with guinea pigs, except last time he was one. Problematically, he forgot that he worked on another movie with one of his co-stars. Richard Ayoade was a perfect casting choice for Professor Marmelade. He usually plays food or animals. Awkwafina was happy to play a character who knows what she‚Äôs doing. Craig Robinson tried to improvise and they didn‚Äôt let the poor guy, but he found his own way to improvise anyway. Marc Maron admits to mostly just playing himself. Hey, if it works, it works! Why change it? Anthony Ramos got an awesome addition to his character pretty last-minute in the process. Zazie Beetz absolutely adored being able to use her eyebrows. Now you might be thinking ‚Äúwhat do eyebrows have to do with voice acting?‚Äù A lot! Lilly Singh is another actor with an expressive face. She was happy to not have to hide that and even happier that her character reflected her so well. And Alex Borstein, who‚Äôs played Lois on Family Guy forever, really enjoyed the depth of her character. Sounds like all of the female voice actors were either loving the self-expression or the depth of plots. Let‚Äôs have more of this, please! It‚Äôs a fun video so check it out if you want to hear about tiny unicorns and cat donuts and Richard Ayoade playing an onion.

videos.title: 15 Difficult Scenes To Film In Stranger Things
videos.description:
Stranger Things has some of the most intense scenes put to screen! And that is in large part thanks to the incredible actors that bring the show to life. Millie Bobby Brown, Finn Wolfhard, Dacre Montgomery and Sadie Sink are just a few of the amazing actors that give their all into creating their characters. This level of intensity means sometimes things get dangerous on set, both physically and mentally. There are numerous examples of our favorite actors losing their voices due to screaming too much. One actor stated they lost their voice nearly every day while shooting! There were also plenty of injuries to go around. From scrapes and bruises, contacts that burned eyes, temperatures that ranged from freezing cold to scorching hot, and nauseating stunts that made actors throw up, filming these scenes was no joke. 

There was also the mental side of filming. Many of these actors were part of emotionally exhausting and mentally draining scenes. This would lead to actors crying before, during, and after shooting. Some scenes got really intense, to the point where the actors had to comfort each other when the cameras weren‚Äôt rolling. Balancing raw emotions with intense physicality was tricky at times. In one particular incident, it led to an actor putting his head through a glass window. 

We are really impressed with the commitment each of these actors have towards their roles. They gave it their all every day, and the results speak for themselves. Which scene do you think was the most intense? Let us know in the comments, and thanks for stopping by at The Things!

videos.title: Marvel Doctor Strange Scenes Without CGI
videos.description:
When Doctor Strange is on screen, wicked special effects aren‚Äôt far behind! In No Way Home, CGI played a vital part in bringing Doctor Strange‚Äôs spell to life. When it came to the Sanctum Sanctorum, well, the weather could be wildly unpredictable - and it was all thanks to some very salty practical effects and CG. It‚Äôs no surprise heavy CG was key for the mirror dimension moments throughout the series. Pretty well every single part of each frame is completely computer-generated! Not only does he cast very cool and sometimes chaotic spells, but he also can float and fly. His powers on set? All thanks to harnesses of all sorts, setting him up to most authentically act out what he was meant to be doing on screen. Infinity War had some epic moments - including a shot of an impressive crew walking through rubble-filled streets - which in actuality were filled with mini fires on a set! 
Need to travel to Hong Kong? Sometimes it‚Äôs not possible, so when that‚Äôs the case, CGI and brilliantly detailed practical sets come to the rescue. While the team did in fact travel to Kathmandu to film for a portion, they also recreated the set in the studio to pick up some shots later on. Who knew a solid stand-in for magic on set would be cord light? It gets a very cool upgrade during the CG process. As much as Cumberbatch was on screen himself, the CGI version of the Doctor took over for a surprising amount of parts - how did they capture him so convincingly? We‚Äôve got the scoop on all that and more behind the scenes on how the movie looked without special effects!

videos.title: Spider-Man No Way Home Bloopers Could Be Its Own Movie
videos.description:
Spider-Man No Way Home had so many bloopers they could be their own movie! The entire cast of this film seemed to have a great time on set. Tom Holland, Andrew Garfield, and Tobey Maguire really enjoyed sharing the screen with each other as Spider-Man, and it led to many hilarious moments that ruined several takes for our enjoyment. The trio seemed like old friends, and could be seen laughing together constantly. Even the simplest of takes were ruined involving the trio of Spider-Men, because one of them would start laughing, and it would snowball until all three were cracking up. But they weren‚Äôt the only ones having fun. Even the big bad villains got in on the hijinx. Jamie Foxx, Willem Dafoe and Alfred Molina all naturally fell back into their characters, and had great chemistry together. They weren‚Äôt so big and bad when they were caught doing things like dancing and goofing off during takes.

Tom Holland is one of the most physical and athletic actors in Hollywood, which made him the perfect choice for playing a character as coordinated as Spider-Man. But a couple behind the scenes bloopers proved that Tom is clumsier than we thought. From sliding into bookcases, to not being able to keep his balance when running, Tom had a couple bloopers that highlighted his clumsy side.

We loved watching the cast goof around and enjoy their time while filming. Which blooper was your favorite? Do you think they should release an entire cut of the movie that‚Äôs just bloopers? Let us know in the comments!

videos.title: 20 Animated Characters With The Same Voice Actor
videos.description:
Did you know some of your favorite animated characters have been voiced by the same actor! While some of the most famous actors in the world provide a ton of on screen entertainment, it‚Äôs their talents behind the microphone that elevate their craft to a whole other level. Stars such as Stephanie Beatriz, Tom Holland and Zendaya are just a few actors who have lent their voices to multiple animated characters, some of which are extremely popular. Just because we don‚Äôt see their faces, doesn‚Äôt mean these actors should get any less credit for their amazing performances.

Voice acting isn‚Äôt easy, which is why it‚Äôs very impressive when an actor attempts the medium, and nails their part. Popular animated characters such as Mirabel from Encanto, Raya from Raya and The Last Dragon, and Bruno from Encanto have been voiced by big name actors. Some of these actors have more voice acting experience than others, but in all cases they shine in their roles and breathe life into their characters. Voice acting brings a whole new set of challenges to actors. We‚Äôve seen Tom Holland's impressive acting range before in his live action roles, but his one weakness when voicing a character is his inability to do a convincing laugh. And some of these actors faced challenges when forced to record their lines from their homes. Working remotely is never easy.

We appreciate all the hard work these actors put into each and every one of their roles. Which actor plays your favorite animated characters? Leave a comment down below and let us know!

videos.title: 16 Dangerous Scenes Tom Holland Had To Film
videos.description:
Tom Holland has now become a full on professional in the stunt community - having already accomplished multiple blockbuster films in the process. Taking into account the brutal nature of those Spider-Man Stunts - we‚Äôve found some of the most dangerous he‚Äôs been involved in.
Holland had a long time to prepare for Uncharted behind the scenes - but that didn‚Äôt ease the injuries involved during the process. And even Peter Parker bumps his head from time to time - but good thing he had his nose to break his fall. Not making those injuries any better for him - though he got lucky walking away with a few bruises and torn muscles. Most of everything Tom filmed within the past few years has been full of intense action sequences. Being knocked back by a water jet and swinging through the air became a new norm. So how does he do it? You guessed it - training and a good outlook on the situation. In fact - most of the stunt-heavy scenes were his own idea. He sees a thrill in this kind of stuff - which ultimately made this process more tolerable for him.
We‚Äôre happy to see Holland taking a break from the big action films - and maybe he can do those flips on his own time now. But please Tom - use the trampoline or put down some pillows! We don‚Äôt want you coming back with another broken nose.

videos.title: From Roc to Diamond: The Making of Alicia Keys & Jay-Z‚Äôs ‚ÄôEmpire State of Mind‚Äô
videos.description:
This song thoooooo!!!!!! Jay and I birthed an anthem dedicated to our hometown, New York City. It‚Äôs officially certified DIAMOND! üíé‚ú®ü•∞ üî•

This is special not only for New York but the whole WORLD!! Whenever I sing it or hear it I‚Äôm reminded that it doesn‚Äôt matter where you come from, or what limits you falsely subscribe to. New York is the metaphor for faith, belief, and hope in yourself and your possibilities! I‚Äôm so grateful and humbled to receive the love from y‚Äôall, a song that has become the soundtrack to all of us!!

Thank you all for the love and support. Here‚Äôs to the magic of NYC, the strength you carry within you and the power of music! üóΩ‚ù§Ô∏è

channel.name: Adam Savage‚Äôs Tested
channel.description:
Adam Savage‚Äôs Tested is a content platform and community playground for makers and curious minds. On Tested.com, the highly- engaged Tested YouTube channel, and at conventions and events, dynamic makers share ideas and inspire each other to build their obsessions. Led by Adam Savage, the Tested team explores the intersection of science, popular culture, and emerging technology, showing how we are all makers. Adam also takes viewers behind the scenes of films, TV shows, theater, and museums, shining a spotlight on the craftspeople and artists who make the magic we all enjoy.

Tested is also: Norman Chan, Joey Fameli, Josh Self and Kristen Lomasney.

videos.title: Adam Savage Reacts to Evil Ted's Aliens Props! (ft. @EvilTedSmith)
videos.description:
Adam welcomes Hollywood prop builder Evil Ted Smith to the cave to check out his latest foam builds, starting with his Aliens Colonial Marines prop replicas! Ted's ability to make foam props look just as good as ones cast or machined is an inspiration, and Adam delights in seeing how these props hold up alongside his own Colonial Marines collection. 

Watch more of Evil Ted's build videos at https://www.youtube.com/@EvilTedSmith 
Find patterns for these builds at: https://eviltedsmith.com/

videos.title: Adam Savage's Dino Build: The Great Jaw Mech Fail (Ep 3)
videos.description:
One of the first tasks to tackle in Adam's revival of his velociraptor costume build is the animatronics that make the jaw and eyes move. It's a bit of mechanical problem solving to adapt the existing neck structure to the new head sculpted by Gary Staab. And while it's not a complicated solution, the implementation of a bicycle brake-like push-pull system proves more challenging than Adam expected. 

Gary Staab's TEDx Talk: Studying the dead to understand life: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8LWfb9fId_o
Learn more about Gary Staab's work at https://www.staabstudios.com/

videos.title: Adam Savage Explores Wing‚Äôs Drone Engineering Workshop!
videos.description:
Autonomous drone delivery has moved out of the realm of science fiction and is already taking place in deployment all around the world. And the aircraft that make these deliveries‚Äìlike the ones used by Wing‚Äìhave to be designed from the ground up. We visited the Wing‚Äôs workshop and labs where they dream up new aircraft, engineer them for the task of automated delivery, and have even built a wind tunnel to test custom propellers.

videos.title: Art Preservation Hidden in Plain Sight (at @metmuseum)
videos.description:
When the Crown of the Andes -- consisting of 5 POUNDS of gold and 400+ emeralds -- arrived at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, its delicate gold arches were sagging, threatening to collapse on itself. In order to be handled and displayed safely, the priceless artifact needed a permanent but reversible mounting system that would provide support while remaining visually discrete. Luckily, conservation preparator Matthew Cumbie was up for the task, and explains to Adam Savage just how he tackled the challenge. (No pressure!)

More about this crown: https://www.metmuseum.org/about-the-met/conservation-and-scientific-research/conservation-stories/2020/crown-of-andes
Met's Object Conservation Department: https://www.metmuseum.org/about-the-met/conservation-and-scientific-research/objects-conservation
This Wood-Turned Cup Is Actually 74 Cups! https://youtu.be/xhzZkD6gytg

The two begin paint tests on the raptor's skin and foam sculpt a pair of raptor claws!

videos.title: Adam Savage's One Day Repairs: Vintage Lathe Drill Chuck!
videos.description:
Thank you, iFixit, for sponsoring this video! Visit their site at: https://www.ifixit.com/

Adam returns from a trip to the local Alameda flea market with a joyous find: a massive Jacobs drill chuck that can mount his collection of large annular cutters in the lathe. With an extended soaking in his favorite rust remover, some manual cleaning and oiling, and a swapping of its Morse Taper adapter, the Chuck is restored and ready to be put to work!

Evapo-Rust Rust Remover: https://amzn.to/3w8uCDW

videos.title: Hands-On with Mojo Augmented Reality Contact Lens!
videos.description:
We go eyes-on with the feature prototype of Mojo Lens, an in-development contact lens with an embedded augmented reality display and the electronics needed to run it wirelessly. With a tethered prototype held up to our eye, we could clearly see how the .5mm wide microLED shows images and text as well as a user interface that can be controlled with literal eye tracking. Here's how the Mojo system works and exactly what hardware is packed inside this smart contact lens!

Shot by Josh Self and edited by Norman Chan
Additional video courtesy Mojo Vision

videos.title: Adam Savage's Curta Calculator Gets CT Scanned!
videos.description:
What's the inside of a Curta mechanical calculator look like? Or how about a Perfect Grade Gundam model? We meet the team at Lumafield, who've created a CT scanner and software that can capture and generate detailed interior models of handheld objects without any physical disassembly. Adam sends a few pieces from the cave--including his cherished Curta calculators and hammered aluminum ball--to get scanned and we explore their fascinating CT scans!

videos.title: Hands-On with Meta's New VR Headset Prototypes!
videos.description:
We get a glimpse of what future generations of virtual reality displays from Meta could look like with a trip to Reality Labs Research, where we meet the Display Systems Research team and try on four of their prototype VR headsets that test the limits of resolution, brightness, focus shifting, and form factor. Here are our takeaways from exclusive hands-on time with these research prototypes, and an in-depth interview with Mark Zuckerberg about the future of VR display technology.

videos.title: The Stop-Motion Animated Puppets of Gremlins 2!
videos.description:
The stop-motion animated puppets created for classic horror films like Evil Dead II and Gremlins 2 are some of the most memorable and creepy creatures put on screen. Adam Savage checks out three stunning puppets from the collection of effects artist Doug Beswick, who worked on the creature animation of those films. The degree of paint and sculpt detail on these still hold up after decades later, and even their revealed armatures show how the puppets were meticulously created to allow animators to give them eerie movements.

videos.title: Adam Savage Meets Original Kill Bill Bride Katana Prop!
videos.description:
Adam gets to finally inspect one of the original Bride swords made for Quentin Tarantino's Kill Bill--a stunt blade with scabbard that still has evidence of its use in the film's production. videos.title: Original X-Wing Model from Star Wars: Episode IV!
videos.description:
Adam visits Prop Store ahead of their upcoming Entertainment Memorabilia Live Auction to get a rare up-close look at one of the few surviving X-Wing miniatures from the making of Star Wars: Episode IV. Inspecting the paint finish and preserved surface of this gorgeous filming miniature is like a looking into the early days of the ILM model shop, with every detail revealing first hand the care and attention that went into the first Star Wars movie.

videos.title: How to Use Threaded Inserts for Wood, Metal, and 3D Prints!
videos.description:
Sean gives an overview to using threaded inserts for using machine screws in wood, metal, or even plastic 3D prints! For example, adding casters to your woodworking builds, or a 1/4-20 threaded insert in a 3D-printed phone holder. Here's how different kinds of threaded inserts perform, and Sean's recommendations for the types to use for various materials and mediums. How have you used threaded inserts in your projects? 

T-Nuts for Wood - https://amzn.to/3Mqg4Hq
Screw-in Inserts for Wood - https://amzn.to/3sGi9qX
Heat Set Inserts - https://amzn.to/3PwdT7g
(NOTE: you want the type with angled grooves - I find straight up and down grooves tend to pull out.)
Press-fit Inserts - https://amzn.to/3wjN0M7
Screw-in Inserts for Metal - https://amzn.to/3lkZvRm
Helical Inserts for Metal - https://amzn.to/3ljCNsF

Adam repairs a laser-cut light-up sign that he made over 20 years ago when he worked at Industrial Light & Magic! It's time to take it apart and give it a new light that will keep it shining for another 20 years!

videos.title: Hands-On with Looking Glass 8K Holographic Display!
videos.description:
We go hands-on with the new Looking Glass 4K and 8K holographic displays and catch up with Looking Glass co-founder Shawn Frayne to talk about what the company has been working on since shipping their desktop Portrait device. videos.description:
Mythbusters fans may recognize the subject of today's One Day Build: the cruiser that Tory Belleci rode and wiped out on while attempting a jump. It's actually a bicycle that Adam has owned since the early 90s, and he restores it to the riding condition it was in when he used to use it as a commuting bike to work at ILM! Don't worry--no jumps attempted here!

videos.title: Adam Savage's One Day Builds: Blade Runner 2049 Helmet Parts!
videos.description:
Adam's back to replica prop building with some Blade Runner goodness! Adam recently acquired a perfect replica of Sapper Morton's helmet as seen in the opening of Blade Runner 2049. And in pursuit of creating a full costume to go along with that piece, he needs to make an articulating mechanical air hose cage that connects to the helmet. And instead of 3D printing it, he's going to hand machine it from scratch!

videos.title: Adam Savage's One Day Builds: Painting The HasLab Razor Crest!
videos.description:
Adam and Norm examine the HasLab Razor Crest playset and spend the day experimenting with different types of paint finishing to add extra layers of detail to this beautiful model. From adding brown rust to a random selection of panels to specular highlighting, we turn The Mandalorian's ship into a canvas for freeform weathering using our favorite paints. Here's how even a little bit of work can transform plastic into battle-worn steel or carbonite. This is just the beginning of our fun with this model!

videos.title: Steam Deck Review: Valve's Handheld Gaming PC Tested!
videos.description:
It's finally here! We've been testing Valve's Steam Deck for the past two weeks and go in-depth in discussing the hardware, ergonomics, performance, and software experience of this handheld gaming PC. From the design of its numerous controls to how well modern and legacy games play on the Linux-based SteamOS, the Steam Deck is a remarkable feat of portable computing and feels like the beginning of a new branch of PC gaming. 

00:00:00 Introduction
00:02:54 What's a Steam Deck and why did Valve make it?
00:07:02 Size and ergonomics
00:08:35 Display and controls/buttons
00:11:39 Touchpads and haptics
00:16:23 Ports and connectivity
00:17:10 Comfort and heat
00:18:37 Screen quality
00:21:00 Speakers and microphone
00:22:40 Storage and microSD
00:28:55 Deck UI Interface and navigation
00:32:05 SteamInput and customizing controls
00:33:24 Suspend feature
00:35:00 Game compatibility with Proton
00:39:35 Game performance
00:43:20 Remote Play streaming
00:44:50 Battery Life and power management
00:50:28 HDMI output to a TV
00:53:15 Linux Desktop and multitasking
00:59:28 Wrap up and the future of Steam Deck

videos.title: Adam Savage's One Day Builds: Dune Sand Compactor Replica!
videos.description:
Adam shifts his focus this week to assembling and painting up a 3d-printed prop replica of the Fremen Sand Compactor from the recent Dune movie! This wonderfully modeled and printed resin prop comes together with a little bit of machining for alignment and glue, and Adam's paint finish gives it an appropriate amount of dusty weathering, fit for use on the sands of Arrakis!

STL for this prop replica by MysteryMakersStudio: https://www.etsy.com/listing/1138298225/sand-compactor-stl-files-digital
3D printing by CorelliaCreations: https://www.corelliacreations.com/

Shot by Adam Savage and edited by Josh Self
Music by Jinglepunks

videos.title: Adam Savage's One Day Builds: Magnetic Lathe Chuck!
videos.description:
In his ongoing quest to "chase zeros" in machining, Adam upgrades his lathe chuck collection with a magnetic chuck--the first time Adam is using one in his shop. But before it can be used, this old magnetic chuck needs to be completely disassembled, cleaned, and restored. This gives Adam a chance to show us how it works and how it should be calibrated. 

Note: Adam's pocket knife is an Urban EDC Supply F5.5. They have two variants on their site right now. 
* Urban EDC F5.5 in Antique‚Äôd Bronze with Elmax Steel (pre order):
https://urbanedcsupply.com/products/urban-edc-f5-5-patina-d-bronze-w-elmax-exclusive?
* Urban EDC F5.5 M390 Blade Steel & Titanium W/ Seigaiha Motif:
https://urbanedcsupply.com/products/urban-edc-f5-5-titanium-w-engraved-seigaiha-motif-exclusive?

Shot by Adam Savage and edited by Joey Fameli
